title.narrative: Corée (la République populaire démocratique de): Aide ciblée aux pays
Korea (the Democratic People's Republic of): Targeted country assistance

description.narrative:
Plans d’assistance technique ciblée aux pays L’assistance technique ciblée aux pays (TCA) est octroyée sous forme de ressources destinées aux partenaires présents dans les pays. La TCA est un élément du cadre d’engagement avec les partenaires (PEF) de Gavi. Le plan de TCA d’un pays est établie selon les besoins exprimés du dit pays lors de l’évaluation conjointe. Un plan comprend une liste d’activités, d’étapes clés, et un budget pour une année dite. L’assistance technique est un soutien non financier fourni par des spécialistes. Elle peut revêtir plusieurs formes : partage d’information et de savoir-faire, formation et services-conseils.
L’assistance technique fournie dans le cadre du PEF est appelée aide ciblée aux pays. Ce type de soutien vise principalement à payer le personnel basé en permanence dans les bureaux pays des partenaires. Il repose sur la demande et les besoins identifiés par les pays eux-mêmes.

Targeted country assistance (TCA) are resources provided to in-country partners under Gavi’s partners’ engagement framework (PEF). A country’s TCA plan is based on needs expressed by the country during the joint appraisal discussions. It includes sets of activities, milestones and budget for a given year.Technical assistance is non-financial support provided by specialists. It can take the form of sharing information and expertise, training and consulting services.
The technical assistance provided through PEF is called targeted country assistance (TCA). This type of support mainly consists of staff permanently based in partners’ country offices. It is based on the demand and needs identified by the countries themselves.

title.narrative: À propos de l’aide ciblée aux pays

description.narrative: L’aide ciblée aux pays de Gavi vise à partager les compétences spécialisées de nos partenaires avec les pays que nous soutenons
Through the partners’ engagement framework, Vaccine Alliance partners support countries’ immunisation activities

condition.narrative: Conditions are detailed in the Partners’ engagement framework
Les conditions sont détaillées dans le cadre d'engagement des partenaires

title.narrative: PFM/FM assessment/mapping/diagnostic/roadmap/financial reform/financial strategy report submitted timely and of satisfactory quality

target.value: Recruit a Consultant to map the various Immunization Funding Streams and suggest reprogramming to ensure that there are no overlaps and identify the activities that can be implemented within a specific time frame given the current situation (difficulties in getting supplies and internationally recruited personnel into the country.

comment.narrative: A consultant has been identified through competitive recruitment processes to map the various Immunization Funding Streams and suggest reprogramming to ensure that there are no overlaps and identify the activities that can be implemented within a specific time frame given the current situation (difficulties in getting supplies and internationally recruited personnel into the country. Recruitment is far advanced and contract has been shared for review by consultant.

title.narrative: Tools and mechanisms to assess and monitor quality and acceptance of services developed and in use by countries

target.value: Recruit a Consultant to conduct Post Introduction Evaluation (PIE) on Meales & Rubella (MR) vaccine introduction

comment.narrative: Due to anti-epidemic measure adopted by DPR Korea government, no international staffs were allowed to enter in to the country. As on-ground evaluation was not possible, so the activity couldn't be carried out in 2021.

target.value: Recruit a Consultant to conduct Post Introduction Evaluation (PIE) on Meales & Rubella (MR) vaccine introduction

comment.narrative: Due to anti-epidemic measure adopted by DPR Korea government, no international staffs were allowed to enter in to the country. As on-ground evaluation was not possible, so the activity couldn't be carried out in 2021.

target.value: Recruit a Consultant to conduct Post Introduction Evaluation (PIE) on Meales & Rubella (MR) vaccine introduction

comment.narrative: Due to current national anti-epidemic measure adopted by country and engagement of MOPH with COVID-19 related decisions, WHO yet to receive proposal as a result this activity couldn't be yet carried out.

title.narrative: Tools and approaches developed to improve and sustain quality and safety of immunisation services

target.value: Recruit a Consultant to improve the quality of immunization service delivery and VPD surveillance including those pertaining to AEFI with specific focus on MR

comment.narrative: Due to anti-epidemic measure adopted by DPR Korea government, no international staffs were allowed to enter in to the country. As on-ground evaluation was not possible, so the activity couldn't be carried out in 2021.

target.value: Recruit a Consultant to improve the quality of immunization service delivery and VPD surveillance including those pertaining to AEFI with specific focus on MR

comment.narrative: Due to current national anti-epidemic measure adopted by country and business of MOPH, this activity couldn't be yet carried out.

target.value: Conduct a KAP Survey to identify the bariers to Immunization including reasons for drop outs

comment.narrative: Due to current anti epidemic measures, which prohibit the entry of Internationally recruited personnel and consultants into the country, this activity is currently being reconsidered and is not likely to happen. Funds will be returned to RO.

target.value: Conduct a KAP Survey to identify the bariers to Immunization including reasons for drop outs

comment.narrative: Due to current anti epidemic measures, which prohibit the entry of Internationally recruited personnel and consultants into the country, this activity is currently being reconsidered

target.value: Conduct a KAP Survey to identify the bariers to Immunization including reasons for drop outs

comment.narrative: Due to current anti epidemic measures, which prohibit the entry of Internationally recruited personnel and consultants into the country, this activity is currently being reconsidered. However, generic IEC materials from UNICEF and WHO especially for introduction of COVID-19 vaccines have been shared with DPRK MOPH for contextualization and translation and this is ongoing.

title.narrative: Learning package for in-service training and performance management including supervision developed and tested

target.value: Recruit Technical Assistance to support the MopH in ensuring Coverage and Equity in Immunization

comment.narrative: Generic materials for trainings for Immunization including for the Introduction of Covid19 vaccines are being shared with MoPH for review and contextualization

title.narrative: MR Vaccine Post Introduction Evaluation Report documented and disseminated

target.value: strengthening routine immunisation through MR vaccine introduction

comment.narrative: The Measles Rubella Supplementary Immunization Coverage Evaluation Report-2019 has been finalized by the Consultant and shared with government and partners. Due to the current antiepidemic measures, dissemination was mainly through emails . Please find attached a copy of the report.

target.value: strengthening routine immunisation through MR vaccine introduction

comment.narrative: The Measles Rubella Supplementary Immunization Coverage Evaluation Report-2019 has been finalized by the Consultant and shared with government and partners. Due to the current antiepidemic measures, dissemination was mainly through emails . Please find attached a copy of the report.

title.narrative: Service delivery approach suitable to reach missed communities identified and endorsed

target.value: Conduct an OPV Catchup Campaign to identify and immunize children missed with OPV in the last 6 months

comment.narrative: Due to prolonged border closures, there are zero stocks of OPV in the country. The MoPH has declined the import of the pipeline OPV stocks of vacines which could have been used for the OPV Catch Up Campaign. This activity is therefore no longer feasible in the near future. A national consultant is being recruited to support the planning of the campaign in addition to other tasks should MoPH change their mind.

target.value: Conduct an OPV Catchup Campaign to identify and immunize children missed with OPV in the last 6 months

comment.narrative: There has been stock outs of OPV vaccines since October 2020 as a result of border closures since July 2020. Vaccines remain stranded at the borders in Dalian. OPV catch up campaign will be planned when there is green light on when vaccines will be allowed into the country.

title.narrative: Training to MOPH staff conducted on the use of LMIS Software and report on the utilisation of LMIS disseminated

target.value: Improvement health supply logistic management information system (LMIS)

comment.narrative: Due to the antiepidemic measures imposed by the Government of DPRK, all planned capacity building activities in the 2020 AWP and to date have been put on hold and a reprioritized 2020-21 AWP is being implemented due to no IPs or consultants being allowed to enter the country.

target.value: Improvement health supply logistic management information system (LMIS)

comment.narrative: Due to the antiepidemic measures imposed by the Government of DPRK, all planned capacity building activities in the 2020 AWP and to date have been put on hold and a reprioritized 2020-21 AWP is being implemented due to no IPs or consultants being allowed to enter the country.

target.value: Improvement health supply logistic management information system (LMIS)

comment.narrative: There has been no progress in this activity. Due to the antiepidemic measures imposed by the Government of DPRK, all planned consultancies including those for LMIS upgrading and capacity building in the 2020 AWP and to date have been put on hold. A reprioritized 2020-21 AWP is being implemented with only key interventions not requiring the presence of IPs or consultants being implemented. Discussions are ongoing to conduct this activity with local consultants in 2022.

title.narrative: Software for LMIS identified/upgraded for integrating vaccine supply and other commodities

target.value: Improvement health supply logistic management information system (LMIS)

comment.narrative: This activity is facing major delays as current anti epidemic measures make it difficult to get consultants into the country to support LMIS upgrade and integration of vaccine supplies and other commodities.

title.narrative: Core team trained on key DHIS2 skills

target.value: Support configuration and installation of DHIS2

comment.narrative: No access to country. Will not do any work on DHIS2 here this year.

title.narrative: DHIS2 installed and configured Costed scale up plan exist

target.value: Support configuration and installation of DHIS2
